newsitem.title: UK: EMS/Mark steadier but continues to probe lows.
newsitem.headline: EMS/Mark steadier but continues to probe lows.

text.p: 1450 GMT - The pace of the mark's early slide on non-EMU crosses slows but it continues to hover just above session lows vs Swiss and probing even lower vs Swedish and Norwegian crowns.
* Mark off lows vs dollar, stg and yen but dollar/mark continues to prowl just shy of near 6-yr high set earlier as Dow stays buoyant while Greenspan gives part two of Humphrey Hawkins.
* Mark/Sweden falls to lowest since Dec 1992 at 4.2795, Mark/Norway falls to lowest since May 2 at 4.1030. Mark/Swiss just off lowest since Aug 1996, set at 0.8108 earlier.
* Market increasingly convinced of broad-based, punctual EMU and seeking for non-EMU floating currencies as havens for now.
* Traders say no sign of Bundesbank or any other central bank supporting the mark, either actively or verbally. Buba council meeting Thursday eyed, may temper mark losses for now.
* Germany's Hesse, Bavaria and NRW show bigger-than- expected 0.5 pct rise in July CPI. No Bundesbak reaction seen.
* France's Strauss-Kahn says EMU criteria about convergence not exact targets, sees Italy, Spain and Portugal in EMU first wave and says all indications are that euro will be stable.
* Mark/Paris at 3.3708/13 vs 3.3687/90 late Tuesday. Mark/lira at 971.95/05 vs 971.75/05 late yesterday.
